definition: to guard/to watch over
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
detention center
watchman

sentences.english: The detention house is the main place for the implementation of pre-trial detention.
sentences.chinese: 看守所是我国审前羁押的主要执行场所。

sentences.english: To prevent avalanches , Park Rangers and Ski Slope managers do what?
sentences.chinese: 为了防止雪崩，公园看守者们和滑雪场经理们做什么？

sentences.english: Not long after, a guard came in, waving a blindfold.
sentences.chinese: 不久之后，一个看守进来，手里挥舞着蒙眼用的布条。

sentences.english: You should have heeded the words of the mahut God.
sentences.chinese: 你应当留意作为看守人形态的神所说的话。

sentences.english: The house is guarded by a fierce dog.
sentences.chinese: 这所房子由一条猛犬看守。

sentences.english: I struggled for a few days trying to come up with a good color palette for Overwatch .
sentences.chinese: 我努力的试图找出一个看守好调色板了几天。

sentences.english: The game-keeper began to skin the rabbit.
sentences.chinese: 猎场看守人开始剥兔皮。

sentences.english: There's an old watchman living there.
sentences.chinese: 那里住着一个老看守人。

sentences.english: Reporters arrived at the detention center, Dong Lin has been eating a bowl Fentang.
sentences.chinese: 记者刚到看守所时，董林已经吃了一大碗粉汤。

sentences.english: A watchman in a building makes rounds.
sentences.chinese: 大楼的看守人进行巡逻。

sentences.english: The prisoners escaped after getting to  the guards to leave the gate open.
sentences.chinese: 囚犯们收买了看守人员，让他们把大门打开后逃跑了。

sentences.english: I asked another of the minders if he thought the protesters were being paid.
sentences.chinese: 我问另一个看守，这些示威者是否拿了钱。

sentences.english: The police carted the criminals away to the lockup for prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 警察把罪犯用车押送到看守所。

sentences.english: That compelled the military to intervene, installing a caretaker government.
sentences.chinese: 那种局面迫使军方介入，扶植起一个看守政府。

sentences.english: Al-Zaidi marked his 30th birthday in jail last month.
sentences.chinese: 扎伊迪于上月在看守所度过了他30岁的生日。

definition: to look after
to guard/to defend
to detain/to take into custody/to imprison temporarily
to nurse/to look after/to watch over/(old) hospital nurse
to have custody of
to guard
to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
to imprison/to lock up (in jail)
to keep goal/on duty as gatekeeper
guard/bodyguard
to stand guard over/(security) guard
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
lookout post/sentry
to be on all-night duty/to be on night watch/to keep a vigil
to send under escort/to transport a detainee
to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
